relation: All course vary upon the professor but the classes that I have take have been at a steady pace with professors available if you have any questions or concerns, during their office hours or by email.
This is a great school that offers programs from certificates to Bachelors degrees. It is a very comfortable atmosphere and very easy to transition from high school to college.
pageTitle: South Texas College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {119524=From a financial aspect South Texas College will give you the best bang for your buck. You will be able to take a lot of different classes and have a chance to major in some really great programs. To give you an idea for a four year Bachelors of Nursing costs about $30,000. That is from day on to graduation. Where as an Associates in Nursing, which would still give you the title RN, will cost you about $12000-$15000 from start to finish. That goes the same form some of the other programs as well., 227253=In the month of November our school has an annual event (Harvest of Health) in which students from diverse programs offered at school. As students, we have the opportunity to put to practice some of the things we've learned and at the same time serve our community., 390427=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 118725=The campus is very safe. In 2010 there was one car theft and three assaults. That is not bad for a campus that has over 20,000 students.}

textAfterTable: I learned a lot while being here at South Texas College. Unfortunately I did not pass my first classes. I am looking to go back but have not found the monetary means to go back. I am hoping to get some sort of scholarship to help me out. Login to rate or flag the reviews Durenda from Mission, TX 08/28/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 9 out of 9 people found this review useful. 2 of 99 Categories Comments Tips for prospective students Utilize the tutoring center as well as the computer labs and study rooms. All of these services are covered by tuition and free to the students. They are a big help and available at any time throughout the semester but are constantly overlooked by students. Bang for the buck The average cost for classes is affordable as well as cost of supplies and textbooks. There are always students willing to help with book purchasing such as
